page.title: 19J.P.Woods.
page.content: J.P.Woods was established in 1834 in the Craven Arms area and nearby Clun Valley.In the early days J.P. Woods was a cottage industry.The Nicholl, Overton and Shuker families were known as "Higglers" and traded eggs and rabbits. The first shop in Craven Arms was at London House in Market Street and it sold game,fish and poultry.Ice was used to keep the meat fresh and sea fish was brought to Craven Arms by train. The families involved in Midland Poultry Ltd.are called the Woods and the Dales.The Dale family was known for breeding turkeys at Caynham about 12 miles away from the Grove where the Wood family were based.The Grove was purchased in the 1950's because they wanted to make the company bigger.In 1968 Unilever took over the company.
